trustfund: TF020460-NORWEGIAN CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND,TF032301-PAKISTAN - HUMAN RESOURCES DEVELOPMENT,TF022590-PHRD-EDUCATION SECTOR REFORM PROJECT,TF022516-NUTRITION PROJECT,TF022625-PHRD-NWFP PRIMARY EDUCATION PROJ.

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall rating for development
            objectives is satisfactory (marginally), but the overall
            rating disguises some variation in achieving objectives in
            each of the project elements, and is a function of the
            heavier weight given to the access and quality components,
            both in terms of substantive priority and expenditure. A
            "likely" rating was given for the overall project,
            despite weak performance in several components, too because
            of the heavy weight accorded to the access and quality
            components. Both World Bank and Borrower performances were
            rated marginally satisfactory. Lessons learned included:
            Clear benchmarks were not established at appraisal that
            would have helped to operationalize what was meant by
            "strengthening" the Department of Primary
            Education. Desired capacities, numbers of individuals who
            would develop those capacities and desired outcomes or
            indicators of progress should have been identified and
            agreed to at the outset of the project. Financial management
            systems and procurement procedures need to be understood and
            in place at the beginning of the project, or provision needs
            to be included in the project design to assist the client in
            acquiring those skills. The technical/advisory teams would
            have strengthened their impact by integrating themselves
            better programmatically, physically, and
            socially/psychologically into the on-going activities of the
            education department. A detailed appraisal of the financial
            management system must be carried out at inception.
